gameset

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameset.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board class for the Minesweeper game. The board contains a 2D array of cells from the Cell class. Credit goes to h.j.k. for the tutorial on https://codereview.stackexchange.com/questions/88636/beginner- minesweeper-game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Constructor for the board class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fail()
      Reveal all of the cells on the board when a game is failed.
      javax.swing.JFrame getBoard()
      Create the frame and window for the board to placed on.
      boolean isDone()
      When the game is finished, this method is called to reveal all of the bombs on the board.
      void plantBombs()
      Put the mines into the game board.
      void reveal(java.awt.Color color)
      Display the color of the cell.
      void scanForEmptyCells()
      If the cell that was clicked on is empty, this method will look for more empty cells around the current cell.
      void setCellValues()
      This method counts number of mines around particular cell and set its value.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructor for the board class. Sets up the 2D array of Cells by running through each row times the number of sides specified

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public javax.swing.JFrame getBoard()
        Create the frame and window for the board to placed on.
        Returns:
        JFrame - The visible frame for the game to take place on.

      • plantBombs

        public void plantBombs()
        Put the mines into the game board.

      • setCellValues

        public void setCellValues()
        This method counts number of mines around particular cell and set its value.

      • scanForEmptyCells

        public void scanForEmptyCells()
        If the cell that was clicked on is empty, this method will look for more empty cells around the current cell.

      • fail

        public void fail()
        Reveal all of the cells on the board when a game is failed.

      • reveal

        public void reveal(java.awt.Color color)
        Display the color of the cell.
        Parameters:
        color - - The color of the cell being revealed

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        When the game is finished, this method is called to reveal all of the bombs on the board.
        Returns:
        boolean - The bombs value checked against the value of the cell being checked for a bomb.
